key_title: Key to the species of Leiocarpa

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Wilson, P.G.
source.title: Leiocarpa, a new Australian genus of the Asteraceae tribe Gnaphalieae
source.citation: From: Wilson, P.G. (2001). Leiocarpa, a new Australian genus of the Asteraceae tribe Gnaphalieae. Nuytsia 13:595-605.

leads.lead_text: Involucral bracts glabrous or variably covered with short glandular hairs, if cottony hairs present then only in tufts below apex
Involucral bracts cottony at least on lower margins
Involucral bracts with apices ovate-acuminate, slightly wider than bases; stems white-tomentose below, leaves green, c. glabrous
Involucral bracts with apices triangular-acuminate, narrower than bases; stems and leaves with similar indumentum and colour

Involucre broadly campanulate; bracts scarious and wrinkled, with a slender, acuminate, curled lamina; scrambling near-coastal herb or shrublet of near-coastal Otways heaths and heathy woodlands; very rare except, locally, after fire.

Involucre turbinate, hemispherical or narrowly campanulate; bracts herbaceous or cartilaginous at least in lower half, with a blunt to acuminate flat lamina; mostly sub-shrubby plants of drier inland grassland, woodland or mallee areas
Involucre hemispherical; cypsela very sparsely puberulous, or at least with a few short, erect hairs near apex
